intro: Buchnera bampsiana, commonly known as the slender leaf bugwurt, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals, and are arranged in clusters. Buchnera bampsiana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in dry, open habitats.
